title: Is Senior Housing Properties (SNH) a Great Value Stock Right Now?
text:
While the proven Zacks Rank places an emphasis on earnings estimates and estimate revisions to find strong stocks, we also know that investors tend to develop their own individual strategies. With this in mind, we are always looking at value, growth, and momentum trends to discover great companies.

Of these, value investing is easily one of the most popular ways to find great stocks in any market environment. Value investors use tried-and-true metrics and fundamental analysis to find companies that they believe are undervalued at their current share price levels.

Zacks has developed the innovative Style Scores system to highlight stocks with specific traits. For example, value investors will be interested in stocks with great grades in the "Value" category. When paired with a high Zacks Rank, "A" grades in the Value category are among the strongest value stocks on the market today.

One company to watch right now is Senior Housing Properties (SNH). SNH is currently sporting a Zacks Rank of #2 (Buy) and an A for Value. The stock has a Forward P/E ratio of 7.34. This compares to its industry's average Forward P/E of 18.15. Over the past 52 weeks, SNH's Forward P/E has been as high as 9.73 and as low as 5.32, with a median of 7.10.

Investors should also note that SNH holds a PEG ratio of 1.84. This figure is similar to the commonly-used P/E ratio, with the PEG ratio also factoring in a company's expected earnings growth rate. SNH's PEG compares to its industry's average PEG of 3.09. Over the past 52 weeks, SNH's PEG has been as high as 3.60 and as low as 1.57, with a median of 2.45.

Finally, we should also recognize that SNH has a P/CF ratio of 10.09. This metric focuses on a firm's operating cash flow and is often used to find stocks that are undervalued based on the strength of their cash outlook. SNH's P/CF compares to its industry's average P/CF of 16.84. SNH's P/CF has been as high as 10.54 and as low as 3.57, with a median of 5.30, all within the past year.

Value investors will likely look at more than just these metrics, but the above data helps show that Senior Housing Properties is likely undervalued currently. And when considering the strength of its earnings outlook, SNH sticks out at as one of the market's strongest value stocks.

description: Here at Zacks, our focus is on the proven Zacks Rank system, which emphasizes earnings estimates and estimate revisions to find great stocks. Nevertheless, we are always paying attention to the latest value, growth, and momentum trends to underscore strong picks.
